private_information: I control truck_0 which is currently at location_0_1 in city_0.
Trucks can load and unload packages and drive between any two locations inside the same city.
In my city city_0 the locations are location_0_0, location_0_1 and location_0_2. Location_0_0 is the airport for city_0.
Packages present in my city at the start: package_1 at location_0_2 and package_2 at location_0_2.
truck_0_operator.goal: Provide a clear, structured description of truck_0 capabilities, local constraints, and the local initial facts that the orchestrator can use to assemble a global plan.

private_information: I control truck_1 which is currently at location_1_1 in city_1.
Trucks can load and unload packages and drive between any two locations inside the same city.
In my city city_1 the locations are location_1_0, location_1_1 and location_1_2. Location_1_0 is the airport for city_1.
Packages present in my city at the start: package_0 at location_1_2.
truck_1_operator.goal: Provide a clear, structured description of truck_1 capabilities, local constraints, and the local initial facts that the orchestrator can use to assemble a global plan.

private_information: I control airplane_0 which is currently at location_1_0, the airport of city_1.
Airplanes can load and unload packages only at airport locations, and can fly between airports of different cities.
Airplanes move between airports (one airport per city) and when flown they change their airport location from one city to another.
airplane_operator.goal: Provide a clear, structured description of airplane_0 capabilities, flight constraints, and the local initial facts that the orchestrator can use to assemble a global plan.

private_information: My role is to audit temporal and causal consistency of model fragments and to remove or flag bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, or implicit time leaps.
I check that preconditions and effects are consistent, that load/unload and move actions maintain object and location invariants, and that sequence dependencies are explicit.
auditor.goal: Produce an audit report that identifies missing causal links, unsafe shortcuts, timing ambiguities, and suggested fixes so the orchestrator can produce a clean, FastDownwards-compatible PDDL domain and problem.

private_information: I integrate model fragments and audit reports from the vehicle operators and the auditor and produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem file targeted to the FastDownwards solver.
When integrating fragments I must keep agent actions distinct and preserve causality and object identity across fragments.
orchestrator.goal: Assemble the final PDDL domain and problem that implements the global goal for the logistics task and is compatible with FastDownwards.

public_information: There are two cities, each with exactly three locations and exactly one truck.
Each city has exactly one airport location.
Trucks move between locations inside the same city and can load and unload packages at the truck's current location.
Airplanes operate between airports and can load and unload packages only at airport locations.
Loading a package into a vehicle requires the package and the vehicle to be at the same location.
After loading, a package is carried by the vehicle and is no longer at the location.
Unloading places the package at the vehicle's current location and removes it from the vehicle.
Driving a truck moves the truck between two locations within the same city.
Flying an airplane moves the airplane between airport locations in different cities.

model_fragment.system_prompt: You are the operator of truck_0. Provide a concise, structured fragment describing truck_0 actions, their preconditions and effects, and the local initial facts you know. Do not emit PDDL. Use a structured description that identifies action names, parameters, preconditions, and effects in plain sentences or simple JSON-like lists.
model_fragment.prompt: Describe the capabilities and constraints of truck_0, the local locations and objects you observe, and any local invariants that must hold for drive, load, and unload actions. Provide the model fragment as a single document labeled model_truck_0.

model_fragment.system_prompt: You are the operator of truck_1. Provide a concise, structured fragment describing truck_1 actions, their preconditions and effects, and the local initial facts you know. Do not emit PDDL. Use a structured description that identifies action names, parameters, preconditions, and effects in plain sentences or simple JSON-like lists.
model_fragment.prompt: Describe the capabilities and constraints of truck_1, the local locations and objects you observe, and any local invariants that must hold for drive, load, and unload actions. Provide the model fragment as a single document labeled model_truck_1.

model_fragment.system_prompt: You are the operator of airplane_0. Provide a concise, structured fragment describing airplane_0 actions, their preconditions and effects, and the local initial facts you know. Do not emit PDDL. Use a structured description that identifies action names, parameters, preconditions, and effects in plain sentences or simple JSON-like lists.
model_fragment.prompt: Describe the capabilities and constraints of airplane_0, airport locations, and any local invariants that must hold for load, unload, and fly actions. Provide the model fragment as a single document labeled model_airplane_0.

audit.system_prompt: You are the auditor responsible for temporal and causal consistency. You receive model fragments from vehicle operators. Your job is to detect implicit shortcuts, missing causal links, and timing ambiguities. Produce a clear report that flags problems and suggests explicit fixes so the orchestrator can produce a valid PDDL model. Do not emit PDDL.
audit.prompt: Analyze the provided model fragments for consistency with the public information and initial state. Identify any missing preconditions or effects, possible concurrency issues, and any bookkeeping shortcuts. Provide an audit report labeled audit_report that lists issues and recommended corrections.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert orchestrator that integrates model fragments and audit reports and produces a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem file targeting the FastDownwards solver. Keep actions distinct per agent, ensure causal correctness, and follow FastDownwards compatibility (STRIPS-style where appropriate, clear typing if used, and avoid solver-specific extensions). Emit the PDDL domain and problem together as the final artifact. Do not rely on implicit bookkeeping shortcuts.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the model fragments and the auditor report to produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode the global goal: package_0 at location_0_0, package_1 at location_1_1, and package_2 at location_1_2. Ensure agent actions remain distinct, object identities are preserved, and preconditions/effects match the audited corrections. Produce a domain and a problem suitable for FastDownwards and label your output as pddl_orchestrator.
